result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Alexander Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick Alexander Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick Alexander Jr was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RA, PSA, PA III without prior written approval from agent. No unsupervised contact with juveniles. Not to be at residence of RA, PSA, PA III without prior written approval from agent. Do not participate in physical discipline.
Participate in parenting class.  Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Final pre-trial on February 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Defendant in court with Attorney Diana M. Van Rybroek.  Cara Jasmine Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Preliminary hearing on January 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Rebecca A., P.S.A., or P.A.
- Defendant shall not be in the 3700 block of E Karstens Dr in Madison, WI.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 2

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Rachel E. Sattler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
